meta.name: description
meta.content: Read Verizon's response to the current outbreak of the Coronavirus known as COVID-19. We stand ready to serve customers at work, at home and remotely.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Coronavirus, COVID-19, COVID19, COVID, hardship, customer hardship,

div.class: entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-fp-hero-display-one-digital fp-hd-one-digital-bgcolor-White fp-hd-one-digital-text-Black fp-hd-one-digital-9 fp-one-digital-borderline-bottom fp-hd-one-digital-comptype-hero-display fp-one-digital-mobview-hide fp-noscroll paragraphs-container-outer section

div.p: Verizon understands the need to stay connected, especially in difficult times. Learn about how we’re responding to COVID-19.

a.title: Go to News Room to read latest updates

div.class: entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-fp-two-columns-one-digital fp-two-columns-one-digital-12 fp-two-columns-one-digital-bgcolor-Black fp-two-columns-one-digital-txtcolor-White fp-two-columns-one-digital-btncolor-Black fp-two-columns-one-digital-linktype-Button fp-one-digital-borderline-bottom paragraphs-container-outer

div.h2:
From the desk of
Verizon CEO Hans Vestberg.

div.class: entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-fp-body-one-digital fb-body-one-digital-13 fb-body-one-digital-bgcolor-White fp-one-digital-borderline-both paragraphs-container-outer

div.p: The world’s coronavirus (COVID-19) response is evolving swiftly. Our customers - whether they’re first responders, teachers, students, families, hospitals, government agencies or society at-large - rely on us to keep them connected. Therefore balancing our employees’ safety against the need to continue to support critical services and infrastructure is paramount.

Verizon is focused on technology and connectivity solutions for the people who are serving all of us during this pandemic -- our first responders, public health agencies, and federal, state and local government. We’ve given these first responders priority access to our network so they can do the jobs required to keep us all healthy and safe.

As a major employer, during this pandemic we are all being encouraged to practice social distancing to slow down the spread and flatten the curve. To that end, we’ve implemented a work-from-home strategy for the majority of our workforce, limiting those in the field to only the essential workers needed to keep our global community connected.

Out of an abundance of caution and to balance the safety of our employees with the critical needs of our customers, we’ve reduced hours and number of Verizon stores open and closed all locations on Sundays. Our customers can still get the support and services they need 24/7 by visiting verizonwireless.com/support/ or using the MyVerizon app.

div.class: entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-fp-body-one-digital fb-body-one-digital-14 fb-body-one-digital-bgcolor-White fp-one-digital-borderline-both paragraphs-container-outer

div.p: We know this is a difficult time and to alleviate the impact that some of our customers may experience, earlier this week we announced that until May 13, we will waive late fees our residential or small business customers may incur because of the economic circumstances related to the coronavirus. And we will not terminate service to any of our residential or small business customers because of their inability to pay their bills due to hardships caused by the coronavirus.

Additionally, to help small businesses who are the lifeblood of our society, we’ve launched Pay it Forward Live, a weekly streaming entertainment series on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at 8 p.m. EST in support of small businesses affected by COVID-19 8:00 p.m. Events will be streamed on Twitter @verizon and Yahoo Entertainment.

We will continue to address these and other critical pandemic issues impacting our employees, customers and society. You should also know that our networks and our people stand ready to serve our customers at work, at home and remotely—including first responders and those protecting the public—when critical connectivity is needed most.

div.class: entity entity-paragraphs-item paragraphs-item-fp-media-cta-one-digital fp-media-cta-one-digital-text-White fp-media-cta-one-digital-ctabtn-White fp-media-cta-one-digital-bgcolor-Black fp-one-digital-borderline-both fp-media-cta-one-digital-align-right fp-media-cta-one-digital-15 fp-noscroll paragraphs-container-outer section

div.h2:
A trusted source for
coronavirus news.

div.p: During a time of crisis, it is more important than ever that our customers can rely on news and content they trust. Yahoo News has created a coronavirus hub page that aggregates the latest news about the pandemic in the U.S. and around the world.

a.title: Go to Yahoo News web site
Go to letter from Guru Gowrappan

div.div: Stay up-to-date with the latest news stories from Verizon.

section.p: Verizon is a global leader delivering innovative communications and technology solutions that improve the way our customers live, work and play.
